page.title: 04CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Not so long ago Swaffham Bulbeck was a small village with clusters of cottages around meadows and fields. The houses were linked together by dusty lanes. The village school was very different. The children (girls and boys) played separately. They also hardly ever did anything outside. No milkman came round then so the villagers got their milk from a farm. Sometimes they made butter with it. People weren't usually born in hospital but in their home. More recently the old peoples homes and Vicarage Close were built.Also to the north, council houses were built. About 40 years ago the pubs and shops started closing leaving about two of each.Young couples with children moved in.These people mostly commute to work in Cambridge.
